value.title: Get a field value from a related table in Power BI DAX RELATED Function Explained
value.excerpt: Sometimes, in Power BI, you need to access a field’s value from another table that somehow is related to the existing table. You can use Power Query transformations such as combining Merge with something else. However, this can be needed when you write a DAX expression too. In this article and video,

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog

value.title: Power BI DAX   Previous Month to Date, Quarter to Date, and Year to Date Calculations
value.excerpt: If you want to compare the sales up to a particular day and compare it with the previous period (month, quarter, or year) but up to that particular day in that period, then it is called previous month-to-date, previous quarter-to-date, and previous year-to-date. These calculations can be more helpful

value.title: Power BI Get Data from Google Sheets
value.excerpt: Power BI can get data from Google Sheet now. This functionality is released just yesterday and announced in both Power BI and Power Query blogs. The feature is still preview (Beta) but it is worthwhile looking at how it works in a quick article and video. Study more from my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/power-bi-get-data-from-google-sheets

value.title: Power BI Paginated Report   Perfect for Printing
value.excerpt: If you want to print a Power BI report and have a tabular visual in your report (such as a table or matrix), then your options are limited. Fortunately, Power BI Paginated report can help with that. In this article and video, I’ll explain the paginated report and the differences between that and a normal

value.title: Power BI Visualization Tip   Hide or Lock the Filter for Users
value.excerpt: I have previously explained that we have three scopes of filtering in the Power BI visualization. The filter created in the filter pane can be often changed or viewed by the user. However, there is a simple way to hide or lock it from the user. In this article and video, I explain how that works. Read

value.title: Trim Vs Clean in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: When applying text transformations in Power BI using Power Query; two very important transformations that can help are; Trim and Clean. These two mistakenly often considered to do one thing, but they are different. In this short article and video, I’ll explain their differences through an example. find

value.title: Visualization Tip   Change to Filter instead of highlight   Control the Interaction in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI reports are highly interactive, If you select a column in a column chart other charts will be highlighted. Selecting a slicer value will filter all other visuals in the report. This interactivity can be controlled easily. Despite the fact that this feature has been released in early phases of

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Introduction to data analytics on Azure
value.excerpt: Introduction to data analytics on Azure

topItems.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
topItems.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

topItems.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.

topItems.title: Explore data analytics at scale
topItems.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Choose a Power BI model framework
value.excerpt: Describe Power BI data model frameworks, their benefits and limitations, and features to help optimize your Power BI data models.

value.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
value.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

value.title: Explore data analytics at scale
value.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Ingest Data with Dataflows Gen2 in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Data ingestion is crucial in analytics. Microsoft Fabric's Data Factory offers Dataflows (Gen2) for visually creating multi-step data ingestion and transformation using Power Query Online.

value.title: Introduction to modern analytics using Excel and Power BI
value.excerpt: This module introduces the Microsoft modern analytics core suite of tools, including Office 365/Excel 2016+, Power Query, Data Model, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI service. By using modern analytics technologies, you and your organization can work faster, more efficiently, and smarter by using Excel together with Power BI.

value.title: Monitor data in real-time with Power BI
value.excerpt: Describe real-time analytics in Power BI using automatic page refresh, real-time dashboards, and auto-refresh in paginated reports.

value.title: Structure analytical report designs in Power BI
value.excerpt: Designing an analytical report involves understanding the requirements and its audience. However, designing a compelling analytical report requires understanding the automatic and unconscious processes that occur when report consumers comprehend what they see. When you have the knowledge of how to structure and apply report design principles, you can raise the level of your report designs to produce relevant, intuitive, and visually pleasing experiences for your report consumers.

value.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
value.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.

value.title: Price Prediction with Python and Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a machine learning price prediction using Python machine learning linear regression model and a dataset of 54,000 diamonds. This will be ported over to Power BI for a deeper level of interaction.  You can find the files and dataset here: https://github.com/Gaelim/Diamond-Price-Prediction
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IP76UJ4nZ70" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
